text.p: These are significant stories in the Nigerian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Nigeria has assembled materials to back its claim for ownership of the oil-rich Bakassi peninsula against Cameroon. A United Nations team is in the region to examine the question.
- Managing director of Port Harcourt Refining Company says between $50 million and $70 million is needed annually for the maintenance of two refineries.
- The military government's timetable for the transition to civilian rule by 1998 cannot be a strait-jacket, says electoral commission chairman.
- Ministry of Agriculture dismisses public scare over poisonous beans, says there is no evidence that rumoured deaths could be attributed to beans.
- Sources say Atlantic Bank planned by government may start operations next month, but not as earlier expected as a merger of three other distressed banks.
